channel.title: Latest news

item.title: Best web hosting in 2021: Find the right service for your site
item.description: Whether you're working from home, running a startup, or building out a larger internet presence for your business, you'll need to select a web host. We compare the best web hosting services available and help you choose the right web hosting provider for your particular needs.

item.title: Best keyboard in 2021
item.description: Finding yourself spending more time working from your home office? Time to kit it out with quality keyboards so you can get more work done in less time while also keeping your joints -- especially wrists and shoulders -- healthy.

item.title: Microsoft Exchange Server zero-day attacks: Malicious software found on 2,300 machines in the UK
item.description: An increasing range of cyber attackers - including ransomware gangs - are attempting to exploit Exchange Server vulnerabilities, so organisations should apply the critical security patches as a matter of urgency.

item.title: With Epyc Milan launch, AMD aims to push further into the enterprise
item.description: AMD says sales of its latest Epyc chip will benefit from the company's higher visibility in the market, as well as the ongoing "compute mega-cycle."

item.title: Google Cloud, Automation Anywhere form partnership to push RPA adoption in the enterprise
item.description: Automation Anywhere's Automation 360 platform will be available on Google Cloud, and both companies will mutually developing AI- and RPA-powered services.

item.title: Google fails to quash Incognito mode user tracking, privacy lawsuit
item.description: The company may now have to fight against user privacy violation claims in court.

item.title: AWS: S3 storage now holds over 100 trillion objects
item.description: AWS' S3 online storage service turns 15 years old and now stores over 100 trillion objects.

item.title: Think local to stay ahead of the competition
item.description: As we move into the new decade, Forrester is identifying forces that will require organizations to rethink the one-size-fits-all model and move to an approach that shifts the balance to more local-specific services and delivery.

item.title: Desktop Metal forms Desktop Health, aims to expand into healthcare
item.description: Desktop Health will focus on dentistry, orthodontics, dermatology, orthopedics, cardiology, plastic surgery and printed regenerative applications.

item.title: Hafnium’s China Chopper: a ‘slick’ and tiny web shell for creating server backdoors
item.description: Hafnium has been linked to recent attacks on Microsoft Exchange Server.

item.title: Preventing bias in AI is hard. Bug bounties could point the way forward
item.description: Deborah Raji is researching ways to apply the models that underpin bug bounty programs to algorithmic harm detection.

item.title: The snags holding back DevOps: culture, delivery and security
item.description: 5 steps for making 2021 a great year for DevOps. 'We need to rethink connection and integrations, both on a technical level and a human one'

item.title: Chrome on Windows 10 will now use a lot less memory, says Google
item.description: Chrome 89 should be noticeably faster on Windows 10 and uses fewer resources on macOS and Android.

item.title: Best Chromebook in 2021
item.description: Not everyone needs a MacBook or a Windows 10 laptop. These Chromebook laptops feature low prices and long battery lives.

item.title: iPhone separation anxiety syndrome: Have we become too attached to our personal devices?
item.description: This is the one where David Gewirtz becomes temporarily separated from his iPhone, has a quiet inner freakout, and wonders if our bond with technology is actually an aberrant psychological disorder.

item.title: LG Gram 17 (2021) review: Still the benchmark for 17-inch portability
item.description: Despite being astonishingly light, LG's 2021 Gram 17 has a tough (MIL-STD 810G-tested) chassis. The screen and internal specs are excellent, although battery life could be better.

item.title: Google: This Spectre proof-of-concept shows how dangerous these attacks can be
item.description: Google issues a new warning about Spectre attacks using JavaScript to leak data from one site to another.

item.title: Liquid Piston to become beating heart of Air Force flying orb
item.description: A hybrid approach to flying machines could quicken development of Urban Air Mobility.

item.title: Microsoft investigates potential ties between partner security firm, Exchange Server attack code leak
item.description: Updated: Exploit tools used in widespread attacks reportedly are similar to PoC code privately distributed by Microsoft to vendors.

item.title: Are quantum computers good at picking stocks? This project tried to find out
item.description: A European bank has been working with KPMG and a team of scientists to apply quantum computing to portfolio optimization.
